tasks.title: Reading
details: Focus: Why analog matters, basic semiconductor physics
COMMENT: Read 1-18 - all CH1 - No practice problems

tasks.title: Software Installation
details: Download and install LTspice XVII from analog.com/ltspice
Familiarize with: component placement, wiring, simulation commands
COMMENT: Just needed an update - already had it installed
Aready had some idea, watched circuitbread - LTSpice - to remember

tasks.title: LT Spice - Simulation Refreshment
details: I learned about Monto Carlo and Simulated it with aa BPF

tasks.title: Lab Journal - Monte Carlo Simulation
details: Document: What you built, results, screenshots

attachments.name: Monte Carlo - Analysis Exploration with A Band-Pass Filter

tasks.title: Video Lecture
details: Watch: Ali Hajimiri Caltech EE105 Lecture 3

tasks.title: LTspice Practice - MOSFET I-V Curves
details: Circuit: NMOS with V_GS=0.6V, sweep V_DS
Run and observe: Family of I-V curves

tasks.title: Analysis
details: Identify on plot: triode and saturation regions

tasks.title: Video Content Planning
details: Screen record: Simulation process (don't edit yet)

tasks.title: Deep Review
details: Create visual concept map: MOSFET operation
Self-quiz: Explain saturation condition without notes

tasks.title: Practice Problems
details: Focus on: Given W/L and V_GS, find I_D and g_m

tasks.title: Weekly Review Prep
details: Create summary sheet: Key equations and concepts
Identify weak areas for next week

tasks.title: Week 1 Summary in Notion
details: Topics covered: MOSFET structure, I-V, small-signal
Circuits built: (divider, I-V sweep, CS amp)

tasks.title: Review
details: Quiz yourself on g_m and r_o

tasks.title: Reading - Body Effect & λ
details: Key concepts: Body effect, λ parameter, r_o = 1/(λI_D)

tasks.title: Simulation - Output Resistance
details: Sweep V_DS in saturation, plot I_D vs V_DS

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Key finding: Longer channel → better current source

tasks.title: Reading - Single-Stage Amplifiers
details: Note trade-offs: Gain vs input/output impedance

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Create methodology: Specs → g_m → W/L → Verify

tasks.title: Build All Three Topologies
details: Measure: Voltage gain, Z_in, Z_out for each

tasks.title: Amplifier Selection Guide
details: Document decision flowchart: when to use each topology

tasks.title: Frequency Response Introduction
details: Simulate: CS amp with 5pF load capacitor

tasks.title: Comprehensive Review
details: Self-quiz: Design each amplifier type from memory

tasks.title: Design Challenge
details: Design CS amplifier: Gain=-15, BW>1MHz, Power<500µW

tasks.title: Major Project - Amplifier Library
details: CS amplifier (3 variants), CG amplifier (2), CD amplifier (2)
For each: Schematic, Symbol, Test bench, Performance table

tasks.title: Cadence Introduction
details: Follow basic tutorial: Create library, cell view, schematic
If no access: Practice advanced LTspice features

tasks.title: Video Editing
details: Edit Week 2 video: Amplifier Topologies Compared

tasks.title: Content Publishing
details: Upload both videos to YouTube with descriptions and tags

tasks.title: Reading - Current Mirrors
details: Key concepts: Why current mirrors, basic operation, current matching

tasks.title: First Current Mirror Simulation
details: Build basic NMOS current mirror in LTspice
Tests: .op analysis, DC sweep V_out, measure r_o

tasks.title: Analysis & Documentation
details: Note: Simple mirror has moderate r_o

tasks.title: Review
details: Quiz: Draw current mirror from memory

tasks.title: Reading - Cascode Mirror
details: Trade-off: High r_out vs headroom cost

tasks.title: Monte Carlo Simulation
details: Test effect of L on matching

tasks.title: Analysis
details: Key finding: Longer L → better matching
Design rule: Use L ≥ 2µm for critical mirrors

tasks.title: Current Mirror Library
details: Create LTspice symbols: Simple NMOS/PMOS, Cascode NMOS/PMOS

tasks.title: Cadence Practice
details: Rebuild current mirror in Cadence Virtuoso

tasks.title: Portfolio & Community
details: Reddit post on precision current source

tasks.title: Video Publishing
details: Create playlist: Analog IC Design Journey

tasks.title: First Differential Pair Simulation
details: Build diff pair with resistive load

tasks.title: Detailed Analysis
details: Create results table comparing hand calc vs simulation

tasks.title: Tail Current Source Effect
details: Compare: Resistor, simple mirror, cascode tail

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Design rule: Use cascode tail for CMRR > 80dB

tasks.title: Reading - Active Load
details: Key: Why active load >> resistive load

tasks.title: Diff Pair with Active Load
details: Build with PMOS current mirror load
Understand trade-off: Higher gain, reduced swing

tasks.title: Review Week 4
details: Create summary sheet on diff pairs

tasks.title: Comprehensive Review
details: Self-quiz: Draw diff pair with active load from memory

tasks.title: Diff Pair Library Creation
details: Create LTspice symbols for resistive, active load, cascode tail variants

tasks.title: Major Project - High-Performance Diff Amp
details: Full characterization: DC, AC, Transient, Monte Carlo

tasks.title: Week 5 Detailed Planning
details: Read ahead: Razavi CMOS IC Ch 9.1-9.2

tasks.title: Reading - Op-Amp Introduction
details: Key specs: DC gain, GBW, Phase margin, Slew rate

tasks.title: Reading - Input Stage Design
details: Design equations for g_m and first stage gain

tasks.title: Design First Stage
details: Input diff pair with active load and cascode tail

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Lab journal: Op-Amp First Stage Design

tasks.title: Reading - Second Stage Design
details: CS second stage for additional gain

tasks.title: Design Second Stage
details: Add M6 (CS amp) and M7 (PMOS load)

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Note: Stability problem to solve tomorrow

tasks.title: Reading - Miller Compensation
details: Key: Pole-splitting, C_c, R_z, RHP zero

tasks.title: Implement Miller Compensation
details: Add C_c and R_z to op-amp

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Key insight: Miller cap creates single-pole response

tasks.title: Complete Characterization
details: Measure: DC Gain, GBW, PM, Slew Rate, Settling, CMRR, PSRR

tasks.title: Op-Amp Report (Portfolio #3)
details: Complete characterization report - major portfolio piece

tasks.title: Week 5 Final Review
details: Self-quiz: Design op-amp from specs (no notes), Explain Miller compensation, Calculate phase margin

tasks.title: Video Publishing
details: Title: I Designed an Op-Amp from Scratch - Complete Process

tasks.title: Community Engagement
details: Engage with comments from previous posts

tasks.title: Paper Selection for Recreation
details: Target Paper: A Micropower Low-Noise Amplifier for Neural Recording
Authors: R. R. Harrison, C. Charles (IEEE JSSC 2003)

tasks.title: Week 6 Detailed Planning
details: Prepare tools: Verify LTspice ready, Download Magic VLSI

tasks.title: Paper Deep Reading - Pass 2
details: Paper: A Micropower Low-Noise Amplifier for Neural Recording
Key Innovation: Sub-threshold operation for low power

tasks.title: Information Extraction
details: Extract transistor sizes: M1,M2 (2000µm/8µm), M3,M4 (500µm/8µm), M5 (200µm/8µm)
Bias conditions: V_DD=2.8V, Total power=7µW, I_bias=2.5µA
Performance specs: 40 nV/√Hz noise, 40.8dB gain, 7.2kHz BW

tasks.title: Sub-Threshold Operation Study
details: Read: Razavi Design of Analog CMOS IC Ch 2.2.4
Understand: When transistor operates sub-threshold, Exponential I-V relationship

tasks.title: Watch Supplementary Video
details: Take notes on: How to bias transistor in sub-threshold, Practical considerations

tasks.title: Build Input Differential Pair (Sub-Threshold)
details: LTspice setup: M1,M2 NMOS W=2000µm L=8µm, M5 Tail I_SS=2.5µA, V_DD=2.8V, V_CM=1.4V
Adjust model parameters for sub-threshold: VTO=0.7, KP=20u, LAMBDA=0.05
DC Operating Point: Verify V_GS < V_T (sub-threshold)
Calculate g_m manually and compare to simulation

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Screenshot: DC operating point showing V_GS < V_T

tasks.title: Reading - Noise in Amplifiers
details: Book: Razavi Design of Analog CMOS IC Ch 7.3-7.4
Key concepts: Thermal noise, Flicker noise, Input-referred noise calculation

tasks.title: Complete Circuit Assembly
details: Add current mirror load: M3,M4 PMOS W=500µm L=8µm
DC Verification: All transistors in sub-threshold, Output DC ≈ 1.4V
AC Analysis: Measure midband gain (40.8dB target), Bandwidth (7.2kHz target)

tasks.title: Paper Analysis - Remaining Sections
details: Study: Measured frequency response, Noise spectrum, Performance comparison

tasks.title: Optimization and Troubleshooting
details: If simulation doesn't match paper: Check gain, bandwidth, noise, power
Create iteration log with changes and results
Final tuning: Adjust until >80% match on all key specs

tasks.title: Complete Recreation Documentation
details: Include: Original Paper info, Recreation Objective, Design Approach
Results Comparison table, Key Learnings, Challenges Encountered

tasks.title: Create Comparison Visualizations
details: Generate side-by-side plots: Frequency Response, Noise Spectrum

tasks.title: Layout Introduction - Magic VLSI
details: Install Magic VLSI with SkyWater 130nm PDK
Magic Tutorial Part 1: Basic interface, keyboard shortcuts
Understand layers: nwell, pwell, poly, metal1, metal2
First Layout: Single NMOS Transistor with DRC check

tasks.title: Layout Practice - Current Mirror
details: Match considerations: Same orientation, symmetric placement, interdigitation

tasks.title: Layout Learning Consolidation
details: Read: Baker CMOS Circuit Design Chapter 3
Create layout design rules reference sheet

tasks.title: Video Content Creation
details: Edit video: Paper Recreation - Neural Amplifier

tasks.title: Community Engagement
details: Reddit post: Recreated a classic paper

tasks.title: Week 6 Comprehensive Review
details: Achievements: Paper recreation, Sub-threshold design, Layout basics

tasks.title: Month 2 Completion Review
details: Summary: Weeks 4-6, Major Designs, New Skills

tasks.title: Month 3 Detailed Planning
details: Preview: Week 7-10 topics (ADC, SAR, Layout, PVT)

tasks.title: Reading - ADC Introduction
details: Book: Johns & Martin Analog IC Design Ch 11.1-11.2
Key concepts: ADC vs DAC, Sampling theory, Quantization noise
Performance metrics: ENOB, SNR, THD, SFDR, INL, DNL

tasks.title: Video Lectures on ADCs
details: Watch: Boris Murmann Stanford Lecture on ADC Basics
Create comparison table of ADC architectures

tasks.title: Reading - Sample and Hold
details: Key concepts: Track vs hold mode, Switch design, Hold capacitor sizing
Design equations: Acquisition time, Droop rate, Thermal noise

tasks.title: Design Sample-and-Hold Circuit
details: Build in LTspice: Transmission gate switch, C_hold=1pF, Unity-gain buffer
Switch design: NMOS W=5µm, PMOS W=10µm, L=0.18µm
Simulations: Track mode, Hold mode droop, Acquisition time, Clock feedthrough

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Key finding: Clock feedthrough is significant issue

tasks.title: Reading - Comparators
details: Key concepts: Metastability, Offset voltage, Propagation delay, Kickback

tasks.title: Design Dynamic Comparator
details: Build StrongARM latch comparator in LTspice
Input pair: W=10µm L=0.18µm, Latch: W=5µm, Tail: W=20µm
Simulations: DC sweep, Transient small input, Resolution test, Kickback measurement

tasks.title: Reading - Flash ADC
details: Key concepts: 2^N-1 comparators, Resistor ladder, Thermometer code

tasks.title: Design 3-bit Flash ADC
details: Build in LTspice: 7 comparators, V_ref=1.6V, 8 resistor ladder
Simulation: DC sweep, observe thermometer code

tasks.title: Documentation
details: Note scaling problem: 10-bit would need 1023 comparators!

tasks.title: Reading - SAR ADC Introduction
details: Key concepts: Binary search algorithm, DAC for reference, N bits = N cycles

tasks.title: Paper Reading - SAR ADC
details: Paper: 10-bit 50-MS/s SAR ADC With Monotonic Capacitor Switching (Huang et al. JSSC 2010)
Key innovation: Monotonic switching reduces DAC capacitor size by 50%

tasks.title: Week 7 Summary
details: ADC fundamentals learned, ready for Week 8

tasks.title: Building Block Library
details: Create LTspice library with: Sample-and-Hold Module, Dynamic Comparator Module, Resistor Ladder DAC, Flash ADC 3-bit

tasks.title: Comparative Analysis Project
details: Compare ADC architectures: Flash vs SAR
Metrics: Speed, Power, Area, Complexity, Accuracy

tasks.title: Video Content Creation
details: Edit video: ADC Fundamentals - Building Blocks Explained
15-18 min covering S/H, Comparator, Flash ADC, SAR preview

tasks.title: Community Engagement
details: Reddit post on ADC building blocks

tasks.title: Week 7 Deep Review
details: Self-quiz: SNR formula, StrongARM operation, Flash ADC diagram, SAR algorithm

tasks.title: Week 8 Detailed Planning
details: Daily breakdown: DAC, Logic, Integration, Testing, Optimization

tasks.title: Reading - Capacitor DAC
details: Key concepts: Binary-weighted array, Charge redistribution, Split capacitor

tasks.title: Design 4-bit Capacitor DAC
details: Build in LTspice: Unit cap C=100fF, Binary-weighted 1C,2C,4C,8C

tasks.title: Analysis
details: Understand perfect linearity with ideal components

tasks.title: Reading - SAR Logic
details: Key concepts: Shift register, Comparator processing, Timing requirements

tasks.title: Design SAR Logic (Simplified)
details: Verify correct operation with multiple inputs

tasks.title: Review and Integration Planning
details: Review all components: S/H, Comparator, DAC, Logic
Plan integration: Signal flow, Clock distribution, Timing constraints

tasks.title: Integrate Complete 4-bit SAR ADC
details: Build complete system: S/H + DAC + Comparator + Logic

tasks.title: Reading - ADC Testing
details: Static testing: INL, DNL; Dynamic testing: ENOB, SNDR, THD, SFDR

tasks.title: Complete ADC Characterization
details: Test 1: Static Testing (DNL/INL) via code density
Test 2: Dynamic Testing (FFT) with sine input

tasks.title: Comprehensive Review
details: Check each component: S/H, Comparator, DAC, Logic

tasks.title: Complete SAR ADC Design Report
details: Create comprehensive professional document: 4-bit SAR ADC Design
Executive Summary: ENOB, power, sampling rate, technology
Architecture Overview: Block diagram, signal flow, design choices
Component Design: S/H, Capacitor DAC (100fF unit, 1.5pF total), Comparator (StrongARM), SAR Logic
System Integration: Complete schematic, timing analysis, critical paths

tasks.title: Expand to 10-bit Design (Conceptual)
details: Calculate requirements: Unit cap matching (<0.05%), Comparator offset (<0.8mV)
Split-capacitor array design: MSB 5-bit + LSB 5-bit + Bridge = 63C vs 1023C
Switching schemes: Conventional, Monotonic, VCM-based - compare power
Design challenges: Matching, Settling, Noise, Reference stability
Create scaling analysis: 4-bit vs 10-bit comparison table
Document 10-bit design plan for paper recreation next week

tasks.title: Video Content Creation
details: Edit video: Designing a SAR ADC from Scratch (18-22 min)
Structure: Intro, Binary Search Algorithm, Capacitor DAC, Complete SAR System
Include: Characterization (DNL/INL, FFT, ENOB), Design Insights
Add: Live simulation clips, Annotated schematics, FFT plots

tasks.title: GitHub Major Update
details: Update main README: Week 8 complete, link to project, performance highlights

tasks.title: Community Engagement
details: Reddit major post in r/chipdesign: Complete SAR ADC design
Include: Block diagram, Performance summary, FFT spectrum, GitHub link
Twitter thread: Week 8 SAR ADC journey
